verses.kjv: Behold, I will send my messenger, and he shall prepare the way before me: and the LORD, whom ye seek, shall suddenly come to his temple, even the messenger of the covenant, whom ye delight in: behold, he shall come, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: “Behold, I send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me; and the Lord, whom you seek, will suddenly come to his temple; and the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, behold, he comes!” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "Look — I am sending my messenger ahead of me to prepare the way. Then the Lord you've been searching for will suddenly arrive at his temple. The messenger of the covenant you long for — he is coming!" says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: But who may abide the day of his coming? and who shall stand when he appeareth? for he is like a refiner’s fire, and like fullers’ soap:
verses.web: “But who can endure the day of his coming? And who will stand when he appears? For he is like a refiner’s fire, and like launderers’ soap;
verses.ct: "But who will be able to endure the day he arrives? Who can stand when he appears? He will be like a refiner's fire and like the strongest soap used to clean cloth.

verses.kjv: And he shall sit as a refiner and purifier of silver: and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them as gold and silver, that they may offer unto the LORD an offering in righteousness.
verses.web: and he will sit as a refiner and purifier of silver, and he will purify the sons of Levi, and refine them as gold and silver; and they shall offer to LORD offerings in righteousness.
verses.ct: He will sit like a silversmith refining and purifying metal. He will purify the sons of Levi, burning away their impurities like gold and silver in a furnace, until they bring offerings to the LORD in true righteousness.

verses.kjv: Then shall the offering of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the LORD, as in the days of old, and as in former years.
verses.web: Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem will be pleasant to LORD, as in the days of old, and as in ancient years.
verses.ct: Then the offerings from Judah and Jerusalem will please the LORD again, just like they did in the days of old, in years long past.

verses.kjv: And I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against false swearers, and against those that oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn aside the stranger from his right, and fear not me, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against the perjurers, and against those who oppress the hireling in his wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and who deprive the foreigner of justice, and don’t fear me,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: I will come to you in judgment. I will be quick to testify against sorcerers, adulterers, and liars under oath — against those who cheat workers out of their wages, who exploit widows and orphans, who deny justice to foreigners, and who don't fear me," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: For I am the LORD, I change not; therefore ye sons of Jacob are not consumed.
verses.web: “For I, LORD, don’t change; therefore you, sons of Jacob, are not consumed.
verses.ct: "I am the LORD, and I do not change. That is the only reason you descendants of Jacob haven't been destroyed.

verses.kjv: Even from the days of your fathers ye are gone away from mine ordinances, and have not kept them. Return unto me, and I will return unto you, saith the LORD of hosts. But ye said, Wherein shall we return?
verses.web: From the days of your fathers you have turned away from my ordinances, and have not kept them. Return to me, and I will return to you,” says LORD of Armies. “But you say, ‘How shall we return?’
verses.ct: Ever since the days of your ancestors, you've wandered away from my commands and refused to follow them. Come back to me, and I will come back to you," says the LORD of hosts. "But you ask, 'How are we supposed to come back?'

verses.kjv: Will a man rob God? Yet ye have robbed me. But ye say, Wherein have we robbed thee? In tithes and offerings.
verses.web: Will a man rob God? Yet you rob me! But you say, ‘How have we robbed you?’ In tithes and offerings.
verses.ct: Can a person actually rob God? Yet you are robbing me! You ask, 'How have we robbed you?' Through your tithes and offerings.

verses.kjv: Ye are cursed with a curse: for ye have robbed me, even this whole nation.
verses.web: You are cursed with the curse; for you rob me, even this whole nation.
verses.ct: A curse is on you — on this entire nation — because you are robbing me.

verses.kjv: Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse, that there may be meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the LORD of hosts, if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receive it.
verses.web: Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house, and test me now in this,” says LORD of Armies, “if I will not open you the windows of heaven, and pour you out a blessing, that there will not be room enough for.
verses.ct: Bring the full tithe into the storehouse so there will be food in my house. Put me to the test in this," says the LORD of hosts. "See if I won't throw open the windows of heaven and pour out so much blessing that you won't have enough room to hold it all.

verses.kjv: And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her fruit before the time in the field, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, and he shall not destroy the fruits of your ground; neither shall your vine cast its fruit before its time in the field,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: I will keep the pests from devouring your crops, and your grapevines won't drop their fruit before it ripens," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And all nations shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a delightsome land, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.web: “All nations shall call you blessed, for you will be a delightful land,” says LORD of Armies.
verses.ct: "Every nation will call you blessed, because your land will be a place of delight," says the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: Your words have been stout against me, saith the LORD. Yet ye say, What have we spoken so much against thee?
verses.web: “Your words have been stout against me,” says LORD. “Yet you say, ‘What have we spoken against you?’
verses.ct: "You have spoken harsh words against me," says the LORD. "Yet you ask, 'What have we said against you?'

verses.kjv: Ye have said, It is vain to serve God: and what profit is it that we have kept his ordinance, and that we have walked mournfully before the LORD of hosts?
verses.web: You have said, ‘It is vain to serve God;’ and ‘What profit is it that we have followed his instructions, and that we have walked mournfully before LORD of Armies?
verses.ct: You've said, 'Serving God is pointless. What did we gain by keeping his commands and walking around in mourning before the LORD of hosts?

verses.kjv: And now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work wickedness are set up; yea, they that tempt God are even delivered.
verses.web: Now we call the proud happy; yes, those who work wickedness are built up; yes, they tempt God, and escape.’
verses.ct: From where we stand, the arrogant are the happy ones. People who do evil seem to prosper. They test God and get away with it.'"

verses.kjv: Then they that feared the LORD spake often one to another: and the LORD hearkened, and heard it, and a book of remembrance was written before him for them that feared the LORD, and that thought upon his name.
verses.web: Then those who feared LORD spoke one with another; and LORD listened, and heard, and a book of memory was written before him, for those who feared LORD, and who honored his name.
verses.ct: But those who feared the LORD talked with each other about these things, and the LORD listened and heard every word. A book of remembrance was written in his presence, recording the names of those who feared the LORD and honored his name.

verses.kjv: And they shall be mine, saith the LORD of hosts, in that day when I make up my jewels; and I will spare them, as a man spareth his own son that serveth him.
verses.web: They shall be mine,” says LORD of Armies, “my own possession in the day that I make, and I will spare them, as a man spares his own son who serves him.
verses.ct: "They will be mine," says the LORD of hosts. "On the day I act, they will be my treasured possession. I will spare them the way a father spares his own son who serves him.

verses.kjv: Then shall ye return, and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him that serveth God and him that serveth him not.
verses.web: Then you shall return and discern between the righteous and the wicked, between him who serves God and him who doesn’t serve him.
verses.ct: Then you will see the difference again — the difference between the righteous and the wicked, between those who serve God and those who don't."
